page.title: 18Golf in Gerrards Cross
page.content:
The golf course was laid out in the grounds of Chalfont Park. It has a clubhouse which has strict club rules which all members abide by. The golf course covers a large amount of land.Both men and women are allowed to use the course,but only men,to our suprise are allowed to use the bar.The joining fee is 500 pounds,with 250 pounds to pay each year. The clubhouse was originally built in an Italian garden, desiged by Edwin Lutyens.Three army huts nearby served as locker rooms and bar.
There are only 5 remaining holes which were part of the original course. Before the time of mowers the greens were mown and watered by hand.They used a horse pulled machine,they would wear leather shoes to protect the grass.It would take 2weeks to water the grass.
